title: dont you love the kind of people that have no logic at all?
body:

yea its literally the way these people are
i like the worst kind .. the adc who blame the top laner for losing bot ..

> "so if i was a tank, you would not have died 13 times in under 16minutes vs a yasuo in 1v1?"

What exactly is this supposed to accomplish? Other than to put the player down for blaming you, and to stroke your own ego?

Don't play the blame game dude, it's a lose-lose situation, and you're only worsening yourself when you stoop to their level.

_Edit: I'm with you on the rest of it. But you're definitely only making things worse with this one particular quote._
Pretty obvious, he's trying to get the mid laner to stop flaming him by calling out his hypocrisy.

Which is exactly what the post is about, players who don't use logic. There is nothing wrong with the op's actions, there is something wrong with his mid-laner's mindset, especially if he continues to flame after being called out.

It is literally pointless to expect the midlaner to change, one is well aware that they are already combative, feeding them with antagonistic statements will only enrage them further. Thus the only likely outcome for the OP's actions is to spark a flame war.

So actually, there is definitely something wrong with the OP's actions.

Nope, its illogical to adjust your own actions based on your team mates attitudes. These are players you will interact with for 40 minutes of your day, then possibly never play with again. Being honest about your feeling and true to your own beliefs is way more important than making concessions for someone who has a shitty mentality just in order to avoid repercussions. If you are correct in your judgement you will be successful in the long run, but if you flip, flop and give concessions based on the player you are playing with, then you won't accomplish anything.

I would argue that the contrary is true. Many players will play the blame game, just like that mid-laner did. If you choose to react in kind, then every time you encounter such a player then you will have a terrible game every time this happens.

It happens often enough that it is unreasonable to expect to be able to freely shoot back in the blame-game without things turning to shit.

Do you really care more about winning a questionable moral victory in chat than you do about having a fun game? Because that's how you stop having a fun game.

http://i0.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/facebook/000/736/222/b4e.jpg

Bro, its not about winning or losing. You can't win a conversation. It's just about staying true to your own convictions. Who gives a shit about what the other guy says? He can take solace in the fact that he tried to stop the other player from flaming by calling him out even if it didn't work. Besides, what other people say is no excuse for you not having fun. There is a mute button literally right on the tab menu. If someone is bugging you, just mute them and enjoy the game.
Pretty much all of that is ineffectual. And you're still advocating for needling the idiotic mid-laner, which is a no-go. End of story.

I guess you have a very loose definition of needling, so I won't pursue this any further. Calling someone out on their bullshit is never a bad thing. And situations like that will only escalate if said individual escalates it himself. Either way, there i nothing wrong with what he said.

As for muting, I don't see it as ineffectual at all. If whether you enjoy this game or not is dependent on other people's chat, instead of your own play; then you are better off finding a new game to play, anyways.

"Pretty much all" is not the same thing as "all." I read most of your comment but not all of it, and most of what I read was ineffectual.

Muting players is certainly effective. And that is what the OP should have done, rather than provide any fuel to the mid-laner's fire.

Way to split hairs. Either way, your opinion on what is effective and what isn't is just that: an opinion. 

Muting should be a last resort, not your first instinct at the sign of trouble. What he said was an attempt to shut up the flamer, but not completely throw all communication out the window. It's completely fine to attempt to get someone to stop flaming and focus on the game by calling them out. Repeating that mistake is where you cross the line into harassment.

I never said that one should not attempt to get a teammate to stop flaming and to focus. I said that one should not do it in a stupid way.

I re-read our conversation and noticed a missing link, so let me clear this up.

1. A person who has a poor mentality and blames others for their mistakes is certainly in the wrong. And they should be stopped, or as a last resort, muted. I'm with you on this.

2. Twisting a persons words back on them or pointing blame back at them will most likely make them angry and escalate the situation. This is objectively true.

3. Angering a person does the opposite of stopping them from flaming. When the person reacts and the situation escalates, it is obvious that our efforts failed to stop them flaming.

4. Thus it is perfectly logical to not use the same method in the future when faced with a similar situation. Provided that you genuinely want that player to "stop flaming."

There are much better methods for "stopping a flamer" than what the OP did. Additionally, what OP did made things worse. So yes it is my opinion that what the OP did was wrong, but it is a well-founded opinion that is backed up by solid reasoning.

If one genuinely wants their teammate to stop flaming, then they should probably switch from ineffective methods and instead use more effective ones. Otherwise there is something else at play, which is why I suggested that the OP's ego was a factor in their response.

_Edit: We ran out of reply space, I'm going to move this to a spot where you will receive a notification._

Aight. I definitely see why you would have thought that after reading what I wrote. I was so focused on opposing things that I overstepped a bit.

It seems we understand each other now. Thanks for discussing long enough to reach this point.

Yeah I'm sure he didn't make a decision matrix XD most likely he got offended and simply reacted, but that's my point. Self control is really important if we genuinely want these situations to be resolved.

Just because it's the truth doesn't make it helpful. A neutral statement of fact that carries the implication of blame is still an implication of blame, even if it is also a neutral statement of fact. The OP is just as guilty of getting offended and reacting as the mid-laner was for doing the same thing.

I don't think he wrote out a whole decision matrix and paragraph in the middle of the game in order to determine how to stop someone from flaming without hurting their feelings. What he said was a natural response to being harassed and I don't think there is anything wrong with it. 

Sorry for the misunderstanding, when I read your earlier comment saying that "Muting players is certainly effective. And that is what the OP should have done, rather than provide any fuel to the mid-laner's fire." I assumed that you meant he should have immediately muted him instead of finding a healthier way to communicate with him. Either way, I see nothing wrong with what he said. Facts are neutral statements, if any offense is taken, then that is on the person taking offense to them.

I just don't see it that way. Statements are just statements. It's ultimately up to the individual's interpretation of what is said, and I don't like any situation where people are forced to tailor their own statements and reactions in order to avoid triggering others, when the real issue is that people are illogically jumping to conclusions and assuming that a statement is negative simply because they are in a negative situation or are making negative statements themselves. 

I have no problem with someone asking why another player has been dying or if they have trouble dealing with a certain champion. What I do have a problem with is: a person taking offense to something that just isn't offensive.
You can blame Riot's policy of rewarding professional victims through bot driven automated systems that ARENT checked by humans.

You had to put up with their stupidity for 15-45 minutes, and lost a game over it. They'll have to put up with their stupidity for the rest of their life. They'll dig a far deeper grave on their own than anything you can throw at them via in-game chat.
